TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, boolybooly said:
> 
> 
> If there is a way to fix the internal links in this thread I would like to hear about it.
> 

I wish I knew ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") This is such an old and great thread, and the sort of challenge that will *always* be a challenge--sad to think that so much history got borked. I don't know what to tell you Booly, if it's just a question of updating the OP that can certainly be done manually, with some work. I wouldn't even try to re-link all the posts in 84 pages.

On a happier note, I orbited a seaplane and managed a safe water landing, have also managed a land-landing. This one's called 'Laythe X5.1' because it's a prototype lander for that moon.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/iFpEp/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Don't worry about updating links for my sake-- I SSTO all the time, just posting for reader amusement ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-05T04:32:38Z" title="12/05/2015 04:32  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 5, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

...Okay so I'm late to the party but based on cursory reading of the rules I've qualified for this prize several times before. What all counts as a minimum submission? Do I need to post a craft file, or a certain minimum number of images?

To start, here's an example of a time I used an SSTO spaceplane to bring some stuff to my interplanetary mothership:  
[![tV5v2XLl.png](http://i.imgur.com/tV5v2XLl.png)](http://imgur.com/tV5v2XL)  

So do I get the prize or do I have to do additional steps? xP
You have to show launch sequence, anything you do from orbit, and the reentry/landing.

I'll make a video then.  

EDIT: The aforementioned video:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mimfHps5KwY?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-05T21:48:02Z" title="12/05/2015 09:48  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 5, 2015</time> by parameciumkid**
  
I hate this new post editor!

OK no fix apparent so I patched it up as best I could and painted over the duct tape. (Thanks Kuzzter for the sympathy and moral support btw.)

Thanks all for your mission reports.

Congratulations to ...

[Bev7787](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2307350) with ssto1.

[Kuzzter](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2308899) with Laythe X5.1.

[parameciumkid](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2309703) Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Cargo Spaceplane.

.. for successfully completing the K-Prize mission and welcome to the all new K-Prize party guest list (I may have exaggerated the all new thing). Please rest assured that the Dog and Booster remains charmingly old school and is dedicated to your beverage and snack requirements.

Gatecrashers Temstar and Kokanee; your reports have been linked and quipped, better luck next time. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

I believe you missed my submission on November 25th =0
ooh im interested in this challenge

Sorry EvermoreAlpaca, I was discombobulated by the forum shenanigins. Congratulations ... etc you know the drill and Huacaya 225 now holds the maximalist record. You mentioned docking but I wasnt sure whether that was a complete mission so I went with the image record you provided.

[Evermore Alpaca](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2298321) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Huacaya 225.(maximalist record holder 511.5t)

I did dock with it, but didn't screenshot that portion of the mission.  I also am working on a video where I have flown it all the way to laythe as part of a permanent base.  Might have to wait til after finals

I took a stab at a small SSTO with "Le Petit Alpaca V1"

5.881 tons Launch Weight, takes off and lands on the runway, with a somewhat unorthodox landing pattern that I will leave as a surprise.  Not a totally spartan SSTO, Le Petit Alpaca has batteries, a solar panel, tricycle landing gear, elevators, the whole shebang!

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q1RhgEnFVQw&feature=youtu.be](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q1RhgEnFVQw&feature=youtu.be)

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/YI5An/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-08T07:46:10Z" title="12/08/2015 07:46  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 8, 2015</time> by EvermoreAlpaca**

Congratulations on completing the K-Prize mission once again EvermoreAlpaca with a very different craft ... looks like that completes the set by taking the minimalist record. - Advanced Pilot Precision Award with [Le Petit Alpaca V1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2313137) (minimalist record holder 5.881t). If you docked during the first mission with Huacaya 225 then you earned the highly regarded Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class ! Good luck with finals. **Edited December 8, 2015 by boolybooly**

So I tweaked the design of the Fire Rat, but it's largely the same (count this as a separate entry from my prior ones if that's ok with you):

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/e5nn6/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Minus the lights, the plane is entirely stock, including aero (the tug is not).  I didn't bother with landing and not refueling, I decided to refuel and launch again ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P").  All refueling was done on the ground, nothing in orbit.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-10T05:21:41Z" title="12/10/2015 05:21  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 10, 2015</time> by iospace**

This is what I call **Proto Nuclear SSTO I**. And a very successful prototype, as it is capable of even a Mun flyby. So, I didn't quite make it to the Runway, but I was close. With some careful landing, it it possible, but I took the easy way out.

EDIT: Okay, how in the world do I insert the album? D:

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/bAFkP/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-13T10:35:10Z" title="12/13/2015 10:35  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 13, 2015</time> by Der Anfang**

I hope this counts as one:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/05r7hP_RB0w?feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

Just an amphibious SSTO.

Congratulations to...

[iospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2316098) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Fire Rat.

- Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Fire Rat after refuel at KSC.

[Der Anfang](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2318686) Pilot Proficiency Medal, Kosmokerbal Commendation with Proto Nuclear SSTO I.

[ABalazs](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=2320596) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Guppy.

...on completing the K-Prize mission successfully. thankyou for your mission reports and welcome (back) to the guest list for the K-Prize party aka the roll of honour.

ABalazs you might want to know that payloads only count for Utilitarial kudos if delivered i.e. dropped off somewhere, otherwise they are indistinguishable from being part of the craft.

The Peregrin, a light crew shuttle. Pictures with fuel/orbit/velocity status are all at the end of the album.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/9n01z/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Well, I wasn't expecting the dry run to make it, so I'm missing a takeoff pic - the following was a run at building an SSTO that could carry the 42-ton STS challenge probe/refuelling package into orbit. It turns out the first messy design managed to do it and land back at KSC - on the grass a bit, I admit. Even did the "orbit has to be within 100 m on ap/pe" limit from that challenge.

All stock, 12 rapiers.

[http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/645503094100813208/9BBD75874489C766BF6041AE290A3A502526CE27/](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/645503094100813208/9BBD75874489C766BF6041AE290A3A502526CE27/)

Is this challenge closed?

No, not really, [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) usually responds after around 3 entries.

My entry.  Despite the name, I think this one works better and looks cooler than any of my previous spaceplane attempts.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/PMCgV/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Well, here goes my entry

I made this plane to perform maintenance missions on my hubble telescope, so it is able to go into a 600km orbit and back, but for the entry I just did a quick launch, hope you like it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/w2omq/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

An improvement on my previous minimalist submission, Launch Mass 4.792 Tons (Excluding the pilot, 4.886 with).  Takes off and lands on the runway, quite maneuverable, as you shall see if you watch the video, which you should!  Bill will be pleased.

Bill Kermans' SSTO:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJvRmn_TLdc&feature=youtu.be](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJvRmn_TLdc&feature=youtu.be)
